name: Beijing
fun_fact: Fun fact: The Forbidden City has exactly 9,999.5 rooms - legend says 10,000 would have been reserved for heaven's palace alone. It took 1 million workers and 100,000 artisans 14 years to build, and it's the world's largest palace complex!

hero_dishes.name: Peking Duck (Beijing Kaoya)
hero_dishes.description: Lacquered roast duck with crispy skin, carved tableside, wrapped in thin pancakes with scallion and hoisin
hero_dishes.origin_story: Imperial dish since the Yuan Dynasty (1271) - the duck is inflated to separate skin from fat, then roasted in special ovens. A proper meal uses every part
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Quanjude (since 1864), Da Dong, Bianyifang (oldest, 1416), Siji Minfu

hero_dishes.name: Zhajiangmian
hero_dishes.description: Thick wheat noodles with savory fermented soybean paste, cucumber, and radish
hero_dishes.origin_story: Beijing's beloved noodle dish - the thick, chewy noodles are hand-pulled and the sauce is distinctly northern
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Hai Wan Ju, Old Beijing Zhajiang Noodle King, neighborhood noodle shops

hero_dishes.name: Jianbing
hero_dishes.description: Savory crepe with egg, cilantro, scallion, crispy wonton, and sweet/spicy sauces
hero_dishes.origin_story: Beijing's essential breakfast, made fresh on street carts - watch the choreographed preparation
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Morning street vendors everywhere, Jianbing Guozi specialist stalls

hero_dishes.description: Paper-thin lamb sliced at the table, swished in boiling broth with sesame sauce
hero_dishes.origin_story: Mongolian-influenced Beijing winter tradition - the copper pot and sesame dipping sauce are distinctive
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Dong Lai Shun (since 1903), Ju Bao Yuan, traditional hot pot restaurants

signature_drinks.name: Douzhi
signature_drinks.description: Fermented mung bean drink - sour, funky, definitely an acquired taste
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: With jiaoquan (fried dough rings) for breakfast - a true Beijing local's test

signature_drinks.name: Erguotou
signature_drinks.description: Strong sorghum baijiu (56% alcohol), Beijing's working-class spirit
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: With dumplings or hot pot - Red Star brand is iconic

food_culture_notes: Wangfujing Snack Street is touristy but iconic for adventurous bites
Ghost Street (Gui Jie) is the late-night food destination - crayfish heaven
Hutong (alley) restaurants offer intimate, authentic experiences
Northern cuisine emphasizes wheat (noodles, dumplings, buns) over rice
